summary: The document is an FBI record detailing Eloy Gutierrez Menoyo's role in the Cuban Revolution and his subsequent activities as an anti-Castro figure. It covers his time as a commander in the Cuban Revolutionary Army, leadership in the Second National Front of the Escambray, his anti-communist stance, conflicts with Che Guevara, defection to the U.S. in 1961, and his involvement with anti-Castro exile groups under FBI surveillance. The document also highlights the internal tensions within the Cuban exile community and Menoyo's efforts to organize against the Castro regime.
key_findings: Eloy Gutierrez Menoyo was a commander in the Cuban Revolutionary Army and a leader of the Second National Front of the Escambray, an anti-Batista and later anti-Castro group.
Menoyo was known for his anti-communist stance and had conflicts with Che Guevara during the Cuban Revolution.
After defecting to the U.S. in 1961, Menoyo was involved with various anti-Castro exile groups and was under surveillance by the FBI.
The document reveals tensions within the Cuban exile community regarding trust and leadership, with some viewing Menoyo with suspicion.
Menoyo's activities included attempts to organize against the Castro regime, including plans for invasions and support for underground movements in Cuba.
keywords: Second National Front of the Escambray
